abstract: In a deal that would have made front-page headlines a decade ago, Rhapsody, the online music streaming service, announced Monday that it had acquired Napster, the once-dominant purveyor of bootleg MP3s. Under the terms of the deal, Rhapsody will take over Napster's subscriber base and other assets, and Best Buy, Napster's corporate parent, will get a minority stake in Rhapsody. Read more »
snippet: In a deal that would have made front-page headlines a decade ago, Rhapsody, the online music streaming service, announced Monday that it had acquired Napster, the once-dominant purveyor of bootleg MP3s. Under the terms of the deal, Rhapsody will take...
lead_paragraph: In a deal that would have made front-page headlines a decade ago, Rhapsody, the online music streaming service, announced Monday that it had acquired Napster, the once-dominant peer-to-peer music sharing service. Under the terms of the deal, Rhapsody will take over Napster's subscriber base and other assets, and Best Buy, Napster's corporate parent, will get a minority stake in Rhapsody. Read more »

headline.main: Rhapsody Acquires Napster From Best Buy
